addInvites(address,uint256).details: Adds invites to an individual profile

params.amount: quantity of invites to add to the profile

addInvitesBatch(address[],uint256).details: Batch adds invites to many profiles

params.amount: quantity of invites to add to the profiles
params.users: array of addresses to add invites

addressBelongsToProfile(address,uint256).details: Checks whether address belongs to profile.

archiveProfile().details: Archives a profile for the sender.

assignExistingProfileToAttestation(bytes.details: Assigns a profileId to an attestation hash

params.profileId: Profile id to assign to hash

bulkInviteAddresses(address[]).details: Allows a user to invite multiple addresses in a single transaction.

params.invitees: An array of addresses to be invited.

constructor.details: Constructor that disables initializers when the implementation contract is deployed. This prevents the implementation contract from being initialized, which is important for security since the implementation contract should never be used directly, only through delegatecall from the proxy.

createProfile(uint256).details: Creates a new Ethos profile for the sender.

params.inviterId: Profile ID of the account that is inviting the new user

params.addressIndex: Index of address to be archived.
params.markAsCompromised: Whether to mark the address as compromised.

getProfile(uint256).details: Retrieves a profile by its ID.

returns.profile: The Profile struct associated with the given ID.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getRoleMembers(bytes32).details: Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

incrementProfileCount(bool,address,bytes.details: Creates a "mock" (user-less) profile to assist with tracking of reviews

params.attestation: Hash of attestation. Will be blank 0x if mock is for an address.
params.isAttestation: Flag if the mock belongs to an attestation or address
params.subject: Address of subject if mock belongs to an address. address(0) if isAttestation

returns.profileId: The ID of the newly created mock profile

inviteAddress(address).details: Enables user to authorize the address of an invitee to create a profile

params.invitee: Address of user invited to ETHOS

inviteInfoForProfileId(uint256).details: Returns InviteInfo struct of a given profile

invitedIdsForProfile(uint256).details: Returns array of IDs that accepted an invite

profileStatusByAddress(address).details: Returns the status of a profile by its associated address.

returns.mock: Whether the profile is a mock profile.
returns.profileId: The ID of the profile associated with the address.

profileStatusById(uint256).details: Returns the status of a profile by its ID.

params.profileId: The ID of the profile to check.

returns.mock: Whether the profile is a mock profile.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

registerAddress(address,uint256,uint256,.details: Registers an address for the profile.

params.profileId: Profile id to be registered for.
params.randValue: Random value to be used for signature. Use case: user can register, unregister and register again the same address.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

restoreProfile().details: Restores a profile for the sender.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

sentInvitationsForProfile(uint256).details: Returns array of addresses that have pending invites for given profileId

setDefaultNumberOfInvites(uint256).details: Modifies default number of invites new profiles start with

setMaxAddresses(uint256).details: Sets the maximum number of addresses allowed per profile

params.maxAddresses: The new maximum number of addresses

setMaxInvites(uint256).details: Sets the maximum number of invites allowed per profile

params.maxInvites: The new maximum number of invites

targetExistsAndAllowedForId(uint256).details: Checks whether profile verified & is allowed to be used.

returns.allowed: Whether profile is allowed to be used.

uninviteUser(address).details: Enables existing user to remove a pending invite and restore available invites

params.user: Address of user invited to ETHOS

params.owner: Owner address to be used instead of current.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

addInvitesBatch(address[],uint256).notice: can hit gas limit if list too long

archiveProfile().notice: This function allows a user to temporarily disable their profile. An archived profile cannot perform most actions on the Ethos network.

bulkInviteAddresses(address[]).notice: It is up to the caller to determine the array size and feasible gas costs. All conditions from inviteAddress are still applicable. The gas cost increases linearly with the number of invitees, so be mindful of potential gas limits.

createProfile(uint256).notice: This function can only be called by an address that has been invited by an existing profile. The inviter must have available invites and their profile must be active.

deleteAddressAtIndex(uint256,bool).notice: Deleted addresses can be re-registered to any profile.Compromised addresses cannot be re-registered. Only an admin can revoke compromised addresses.

incrementProfileCount(bool,address,bytes.notice: Only callable by EthosReview.sol and EthosAttestation.sol

inviteAddress(address).notice: This function checks if the sender has available invites and if the invitee is eligible to receive an invite. It updates the invite information and emits an event.

profileExistsAndArchivedForId(uint256).notice: LEGACY INTERFACE FUNCTIONS These satisfy the IEthosProfile interface but are more difficult to understand than profileStatus* functions and should be deprecated on the next major upgrade.

registerAddress(address,uint256,uint256,.notice: This function allows a user to add a new address to their profile. The address must not be compromised or already associated with another profile.

restoreProfile().notice: This function allows a user to reactivate their previously archived profile.

targetExistsAndAllowedForId(uint256).notice: This is a standard function used across Ethos contracts to validate profiles.
